meanings.definition: A decrease or decline in quantity or quality.
meanings.sent1: The falloff in sales was noticeable last month.
meanings.sent2: The falloff in the number of students attending the school was concerning.
meanings.sent3: The falloff in candy left at the party was so drastic, it was like a disappearing act!
meanings.sent4: The falloff in motivation felt like a weight dragging me down.
meanings.sent5: The falloff in temperature made the room feel chilly and unwelcoming.

meanings.definition: The act of falling off or dropping.
meanings.sent1: The falloff of the book from the shelf startled me.
meanings.sent2: The falloff of leaves from the tree signaled the start of autumn.
meanings.sent3: The falloff of the pen from the desk seemed to defy gravity for a moment.
meanings.sent4: The falloff of raindrops from the roof created a soothing sound.
meanings.sent5: The falloff of the rock from the cliff was a sudden and unexpected event.
